required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PHASES: Provision of HIV Treatment at ATN Sites: An Evaluation for Stakeholders
clinical_study.official_title: PHASES: Provision of HIV Treatment at ATN Sites: An Evaluation for Stakeholders

lead_sponsor.agency: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

clinical_study.source: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

brief_summary.textblock: This is an observational study involving retrospective and prospective medical record review covering a total maximum of 104 weeks (24 months) per subject. An Audio Computer- Assisted Self-Interview (ACASI) at study entry will assess demographic and psychosocial variables of study subjects. Data will also be collected to assess clinic level variables. Definitions of engagement, prescription of antiretroviral therapy (ART), and viral suppression in the Continuum of Care (CoC) will utilize common definitions including those by U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS) and Health Resources and Services Administration (HRSA) HIV/AIDS Bureau (HAB). Data will be collected in a large, simple trial design manner to provide all elements for both the primary and secondary outcomes.

detailed_description.textblock: This is an observational study involving retrospective and prospective medical record review covering a total maximum of 104 weeks (24 months) per subject. Behavioral data will be collected via ACASI at study entry to assess demographic and psychosocial variables of study subjects. All other data (biomedical, ART, healthcare utilization) at subsequent study visits will be collected via medical record abstraction. Information about missed visits as well as other healthcare utilization data can be abstracted from electronic appointment systems or other electronic systems at the clinical sites. Subject data will be abstracted from medical records for up to a maximum 26 weeks prior to the baseline study visit, as well as up to a maximum 78 weeks after the baseline study visit or through January 31, 2017, whichever occurs first, for a total maximum of 104 weeks or two years per subject. Data will also be collected from each Adolescent Medicine Trials Unit to assess clinic level variables at baseline (within 30 days of protocol registration) and 48 and 96 weeks after baseline. Definitions of engagement, prescription of antiretroviral therapy (ART), and viral suppression in the Continuum of Care (CoC) will utilize common definitions including those by U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS) and Health Resources and Services Administration (HRSA) HIV/AIDS Bureau (HAB). Data will be collected in a large, simple trial design manner to provide all elements for both the primary and secondary outcomes.

primary_outcome.measure: The proportion of subjects engaged in care at Baseline, per subject year, as defined by the HRSA HAB measure
The proportion of subjects engaged in care at Week 26, per subject year, as defined by the HRSA HAB measure
The proportion of subjects engaged in care at Week 52, per subject year, as defined by the HRSA HAB measure
The proportion of subjects engaged in care at Week 78, per subject year, as defined by the HRSA HAB measure
The proportion of subjects engaged in care at Baseline, per subject year, as defined by the DHHS measure
The proportion of subjects engaged in care at Week 26, per subject year, as defined by the DHHS measure
The proportion of subjects engaged in care at Week 52, per subject year, as defined by the DHHS measure
The proportion of subjects engaged in care at Week 78, per subject year, as defined by the DHHS measure
The proportion of subjects prescribed antiretroviral therapy at Baseline per subject year
The proportion of subjects prescribed antiretroviral therapy at Week 26 per subject year
The proportion of subjects prescribed antiretroviral therapy at Week 52 per subject year
The proportion of subjects prescribed antiretroviral therapy at Week 78 per subject year
The proportion of subjects that have achieved viral suppression at Baseline per subject year
The proportion of subjects that have achieved viral suppression at Week 26 per subject year
The proportion of subjects that have achieved viral suppression at Week 52 per subject year
The proportion of subjects that have achieved viral suppression at Week 78 per subject year

secondary_outcome.measure: The proportion of subjects with advanced HIV disease at time of first clinical visit defined as a CD4 count < 200 cells/mm3
The incidence of STIs in the study population as an indicator of transmission risk at Baseline
The incidence of STIs in the study population as an indicator of transmission risk at Week 26
The incidence of STIs in the study population as an indicator of transmission risk at Week 52
The incidence of STIs in the study population as an indicator of transmission risk at Week 78
Number of subjects with mental health issues at Baseline
Number of subjects engaging in substance use at Baseline
Number of subjects engaging in sexual risk behaviors at Baseline
Frequency of missed clinic visits at Baseline
Frequency of missed clinic visits at Week 26
Frequency of missed clinic visits at Week 52
Frequency of missed clinic visits at Week 78
Types of services available at each AMTU at Baseline
Types of services available at each AMTU at 48 weeks after Baseline
Types of services available at each AMTU at 96 weeks after Baseline
Proportion of subjects notifying their sexual partners after learning their HIV status
Timing of subjects notifying their partners after learning about their HIV status
Proportion of subjects with whom partner notification was discussed

overall_official.affiliation: New York University School of Medicine

facility.name: University of Miami School of Medicine
